document.masterDocTitle: Review of the subgenus Ammosphex Wilcke, 1942 of the genus Arachnospila Kincaid, 1900 (Hymenoptera: Pompilidae) of the Russian Far East and East Siberia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis of male. The male of this species is easily distinguished from other males of the subgenus
Ammosphex
by having the hypopygium baso-laterally distinctly carinate (
Fig. 19
vs . 1 –18, 20– 37 ). Genitalia as in
Fig. 56
.

Diagnosis of female. The female of this species is very similar to that of
Arachnospila ( Ammosphex ) eoabnormis Lelej, 1995
, but differs by having
2 r-m
cell of fore wing wider than
3 r-m
cell (
2 r-m
cell equal to
3 r-m
cell in width in
A. ( A. ) eoabnormis
) (Figs 115, 116 vs . 100, 101 ). Clypeus as in
Fig. 70
. Metapostnotum as in
Fig. 90
.

Biology. Inhabits different biotopes: sandy-stone shores along rivers, glades in broad-leaved forest, sandy shores beside the sea, and also steppe areas.
